Links: [{"title":"Feature Request: Add Checkpointing/Rewind Capability · Issue #10223 · google-gemini/gemini-cli","url":"https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli/issues/10223"},{"title":"Rewind file changes with checkpointing - Claude API Docs","url":"https://platform.claude.com/docs/en/agent-sdk/file-checkpointing"},{"title":"Checkpointing - Claude Code Docs","url":"https://code.claude.com/docs/en/checkpointing"},{"title":"feature: ability to rewind · Issue #338 · anomalyco/opencode","url":"https://github.com/anomalyco/opencode/issues/338"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about dev tool CLI rewind and snapshot checkpoint functionality:

## Claude Code Checkpointing

File checkpointing tracks file modifications made through the Write, Edit, and NotebookEdit tools during an agent session, allowing you to rewind files to any previous state.

### How to Use Rewind in Claude Code

You can press Esc twice (Esc + Esc) or use the /rewind command to open the rewind menu. A scrollable list shows each of your prompts from the session.

### CLI Rewind Usage

If you capture the session ID and checkpoint ID, you can also rewind from the CLI: claude --resume <session-id> --rewind-files <checkpoint-uuid>

### Important Limitations

Checkpointing does not track files modified by bash commands - only direct file edits made through Claude's file editing tools are tracked. File rewinding restores files on disk to a previous state but does not rewind the conversation itself; the conversation history and context remain intact after rewinding.

### Version Control Integration

Checkpoints are designed for quick, session-level recovery. For permanent version history and collaboration, you should continue using version control like Git for commits, branches, and long-term history - checkpoints complement but don't replace proper version control.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

input.prompt: Read the entire README and documentation. I need to understand: 1) What is Entire CLI? 2) How do rewind points work? 3) What commands are available, especially for creating rewind points? 4) Any configuration details. Give me ALL the details from the README.

content.content:
# Entire CLI: Complete Overview

## What is Entire CLI?

Entire is a developer platform that captures AI agent sessions during your git workflow. According to the documentation, it "hooks into your git workflow to capture AI agent sessions on every push, unifying your code with its context and reasoning." The tool integrates with Claude Code or Gemini CLI to create searchable records of how code was written, storing session metadata separately from your actual commits on a dedicated branch.

## How Rewind Points Work

The system uses two key concepts:

**Sessions**: Represent complete interactions with your AI agent from start to finish, capturing all prompts, responses, modified files, and timestamps. Sessions use the format `YYYY-MM-DD-<UUID>`.

**Checkpoints**: These are snapshots within a session—essentially "save points" in your work. Checkpoint IDs are 12-character hex strings (e.g., `a3b2c4d5e6f7`). When checkpoints are created depends on your chosen strategy:
- **Manual-commit**: Triggered when you or the agent make a git commit
- **Auto-commit**: Triggered after each agent response

Checkpoints are stored on the `entire/checkpoints/v1` branch, completely separate from your code commits, keeping your git history clean.

## Available Commands

| Command | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `entire enable` | Activate Entire in your repository (default: manual-commit strategy) |
| `entire status` | Display current session and strategy information |
| `entire rewind` | Select and restore to a previous checkpoint |
| `entire resume <branch>` | Restore session metadata for a branch and show continuation commands |
| `entire disable` | Remove Entire hooks from the repository |
| `entire reset` | Delete shadow branch and session state for current HEAD commit |
| `entire doctor` | Fix or clean up stuck sessions |
| `entire explain` | Explain a session or commit |
| `entire clean` | Remove orphaned data not cleaned up automatically |
| `entire version` | Display CLI version |

### Enable Flags

The `entire enable` command accepts several flags:

- `--strategy <name>`: Choose `manual-commit` (default) or `auto-commit`
- `--agent <name>`: Select `claude-code` (default) or `gemini`
- `--force` / `-f`: Force reinstall hooks
- `--local`: Save settings to local file instead of project-wide
- `--skip-push-sessions`: Disable automatic pushing of session logs
- `--telemetry=false`: Opt out of usage analytics

## Configuration Details

Entire uses two configuration files in the `.entire/` directory:

**settings.json** (committed to git):
```json
{
  "strategy": "manual-commit",
  "agent": "claude-code",
  "enabled": true
}
```

**settings.local.json** (gitignored):
```json
{
  "enabled": false,
  "log_level": "debug"
}
```

### Configuration Options

| Option | Values | Purpose |
|--------|--------|---------|
| `enabled` | true/false | Toggle Entire on/off |
| `log_level` | debug, info, warn, error | Logging verbosity |
| `strategy` | manual-commit, auto-commit | When to capture checkpoints |
| `strategy_options.push_sessions` | true/false | Auto-push checkpoint branch |
| `strategy_options.summarize.enabled` | true/false | Auto-generate AI summaries at commit |
| `telemetry` | true/false | Send anonymous usage data |

### Strategy Comparison

**Manual-Commit** (recommended for most workflows):
- No automatic code commits on your branch
- Safe to use on main branch
- Always allows non-destructive rewind

**Auto-Commit**:
- Creates commits automatically after each agent response
- Use with caution on main branch
- Full rewind on feature branches; logs-only on main

## Additional Features

**Auto-Summarization**: When enabled, Entire generates AI-powered summaries at commit time, capturing intent, outcomes, learnings, friction points, and open items. Requires Claude CLI installation.

**Gemini CLI Support**: Available in preview; can run alongside Claude Code with both agents' hooks enabled simultaneously.

**Git Worktrees**: Fully supported with independent session tracking per worktree.

**Concurrent Sessions**: Multiple sessions can run on the same commit; each tracked independently with separate checkpoints.

## Requirements

- Git
- macOS or Linux (Windows via WSL)
- Claude Code or Gemini CLI installed and authenticated

The tool maintains complete separation between your code commits and session metadata, ensuring your repository history remains pristine while preserving comprehensive development context.

input.content:
# Entire CLI

Entire is a developer platform that hooks into your git workflow to capture AI agent sessions on every push, unifying your code with its context and reasoning.

## Key Concepts

**Sessions**: Complete interactions with your AI agent from start to finish, capturing all prompts, responses, modified files, and timestamps. Format: `YYYY-MM-DD-<UUID>`.

**Checkpoints (Rewind Points)**: Snapshots within a session -- "save points" in your work. Checkpoint IDs are 12-character hex strings (e.g., `a3b2c4d5e6f7`). Stored on the `entire/checkpoints/v1` branch, separate from your code commits.

## Checkpoint Strategies

| Strategy | Behavior | Main Branch Safe? |
|----------|----------|-------------------|
| `manual-commit` | Triggered on git commit | Yes |
| `auto-commit` | Triggered after each agent response | Use with caution |

## Commands

| Command | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `entire enable` | Activate Entire in your repository |
| `entire status` | Display current session and strategy info |
| `entire rewind` | Select and restore to a previous checkpoint |
| `entire resume <branch>` | Restore session metadata for a branch |
| `entire disable` | Remove Entire hooks |
| `entire reset` | Delete shadow branch and session state |
| `entire doctor` | Fix or clean up stuck sessions |
| `entire explain` | Explain a session or commit |
| `entire clean` | Remove orphaned data |
| `entire version` | Display CLI version |

## Enable Flags

- `--strategy <name>`: `manual-commit` (default) or `auto-commit`
- `--agent <name>`: `claude-code` (default) or `gemini`
- `--force` / `-f`: Force reinstall hooks
- `--local`: Save settings to local file instead of project-wide
- `--skip-push-sessions`: Disable automatic pushing of session logs
- `--telemetry=false`: Opt out of usage analytics

## Configuration

Settings live in `.entire/settings.json` (committed) and `.entire/settings.local.json` (gitignored).

| Option | Values | Purpose |
|--------|--------|---------|
| `enabled` | true/false | Toggle Entire on/off |
| `log_level` | debug, info, warn, error | Logging verbosity |
| `strategy` | manual-commit, auto-commit | When to capture checkpoints |
| `strategy_options.push_sessions` | true/false | Auto-push checkpoint branch |
| `strategy_options.summarize.enabled` | true/false | Auto-generate AI summaries |
| `telemetry` | true/false | Send anonymous usage data |

## Requirements

- Git
- macOS or Linux (Windows via WSL)
- Claude Code or Gemini CLI installed and authenticated

toolUseResult.content:
# Entire CLI

Entire is a developer platform that hooks into your git workflow to capture AI agent sessions on every push, unifying your code with its context and reasoning.

## Key Concepts

**Sessions**: Complete interactions with your AI agent from start to finish, capturing all prompts, responses, modified files, and timestamps. Format: `YYYY-MM-DD-<UUID>`.

**Checkpoints (Rewind Points)**: Snapshots within a session -- "save points" in your work. Checkpoint IDs are 12-character hex strings (e.g., `a3b2c4d5e6f7`). Stored on the `entire/checkpoints/v1` branch, separate from your code commits.

## Checkpoint Strategies

| Strategy | Behavior | Main Branch Safe? |
|----------|----------|-------------------|
| `manual-commit` | Triggered on git commit | Yes |
| `auto-commit` | Triggered after each agent response | Use with caution |

## Commands

| Command | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `entire enable` | Activate Entire in your repository |
| `entire status` | Display current session and strategy info |
| `entire rewind` | Select and restore to a previous checkpoint |
| `entire resume <branch>` | Restore session metadata for a branch |
| `entire disable` | Remove Entire hooks |
| `entire reset` | Delete shadow branch and session state |
| `entire doctor` | Fix or clean up stuck sessions |
| `entire explain` | Explain a session or commit |
| `entire clean` | Remove orphaned data |
| `entire version` | Display CLI version |

## Enable Flags

- `--strategy <name>`: `manual-commit` (default) or `auto-commit`
- `--agent <name>`: `claude-code` (default) or `gemini`
- `--force` / `-f`: Force reinstall hooks
- `--local`: Save settings to local file instead of project-wide
- `--skip-push-sessions`: Disable automatic pushing of session logs
- `--telemetry=false`: Opt out of usage analytics

## Configuration

Settings live in `.entire/settings.json` (committed) and `.entire/settings.local.json` (gitignored).

| Option | Values | Purpose |
|--------|--------|---------|
| `enabled` | true/false | Toggle Entire on/off |
| `log_level` | debug, info, warn, error | Logging verbosity |
| `strategy` | manual-commit, auto-commit | When to capture checkpoints |
| `strategy_options.push_sessions` | true/false | Auto-push checkpoint branch |
| `strategy_options.summarize.enabled` | true/false | Auto-generate AI summaries |
| `telemetry` | true/false | Send anonymous usage data |

## Requirements

- Git
- macOS or Linux (Windows via WSL)
- Claude Code or Gemini CLI installed and authenticated
